text: Bottle from Oddbins Rosemount. Pours black with soft thin tan head. Aromas are plentiful with cocoa, chocolate praline, soft roast malt, very light citrus freshness and dry grain. Tastes like a smooth but roasty mocha. Very chocolatey. A fantastic soft creamy full body with a gentle but dry sparkle. This is an absolutely top drawer sweet stout. Like a mocha praline chocolate with a smooth roasty bitter finish. I love it.

Zwart bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: zurige koffie, zwarte chocolade, geroosterde mout. Smaak: geroosterde moutbitterheid, lichtjes chocolade en een vleugje koffie. Glad mondgevoel. Lichte koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: wat kleverig zoet.

Bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lasting brown head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, cocoa and light earthiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of coffee, roasted malt and cocoa with a smooth lingering mocha finish.

Bottle from K&L in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, some roasty malts, maybe some blueberries. Taste is tangy and fruity coffee with dark chocolate and dark ripe fruit vibes (cherries or blueberries). Awesome. Reminded me more of a Coffee Porter but overall this had tons of fresh and tangy coffee fruit tang.
Fra keg på Small Bar Bristol 1 Mai 17. Svart. Filmskum. Lett lakrisaroma. Smaken lakris & sjokolade. Veldig søt.

33cl bottle at home from Brewdog webshop. Nose is coffee, roasted malt. Body is black, head is small, frothy, brownish, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is roasted malty, smoked old wood, peat, mild roasted coffee, milk chocolate. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bittersweet. Medium to full body, slick texture, medium carbonation. Quite easy dessert beer, bit sweeter than Id like, but not bad.
Black with almost white head. Aroma is roasted and coffee. Taste is also roasted and coffee, but with lactose and chocolate as well. Very nice aftertaste.
Drank with Rik 23-05-17. Full body especially for the abv. Not a bad coffee taste, but some artificial sweetness with this tuinbonen smaak

22-04-2017; draft; All your friends, Moscow, Russia.
The beer looks lovely. It is like a stout should look like. The color of the beer is a very dark brown, almost black. It is to dark to check the clarity. On top of the beer there is a nice layer of smooth light brown foam. Lovely.
The smell of the beer is lovely. Its real stout. I smell nice toasted malt aromas. There is coffee, some nice bitter and slightly savoury roast and a nice mild touch of liquorice. There is a tiny hoppy bitterness and fruitiness in there to.
The taste is just as good. Full taste of bitter sweet chocolate, lovely coffee. The malt flavours are amazing. Such clear flavours. Sweets, bitters and slightly savoury notes are in perfect balance. Great.
The palate is a lso lovely. Nice smooth and creamy texture, full body and a lovely long dark chocolate finish. Amazing.
Growler from Freebeerco, The Hague. Nose: coffee, roasted malt. Taste: coffee, sweetness, chocolate, roastiness, mellow bitter.
Bottle @ home. Pours deep black with a dark tan head. Notes of sweet malts, milky sweet, light coffee, caramel and some vanilla. Really enjoyable.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord. Pours black with a small white to light grey head. Red fruit and well rounded coffee nose. Coffee, sweet liquorice, red fruit and berries, some smoke and leather flavour. Very smooth body. Medium to thick. Oily. Some warmth. Soft carbonation. Very good stout. Impressive.
Cask at Reading Beer Festival. Pleased to see this available as bottle generally tastes great. Strong coffee overtones with plenty of oats too. Perfect for any time of day.

330ml bottle. Pours black with a one-finger tan head. Aroma: smokey roasted malt, chocolate. Taste: sweet malt, chocolate, roasted smokey malt notes, dark fruit, light bitter finish. Medium body, smooth velvety mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice stout... drank side by side with the Bourbon Coffee version which I felt was a slight improvement over this.

Bottle from Valhallas Goat, Glasgow. Beer served in 10°C, Teku Glass. Pours black with no head at all. Im not sure how long that beer was been stored in the shop, but coffee flavor is completely not noticeable here. Lactose maybe a little more, but still hidden, somewhere under stoutish sourness and roasted malt. Oats not making that beer creamy, but texture is oily and pleasant, what is a strong side of that beer. Overall it taste, smell and feel like classic stout. Good beer for someone who like classic styles without additives or special ingredients added. Acid stout with nice, long aftertaste.
Black colour with white foam. Aroma and taste of coffee and chocolate but very fresh!

How: Bottle. Aroma: Caramel, toast, roasty coffee and chocolate beans. Appearance: Dark hazy black with short lasting brown head. Taste: light to medium sweet, light bitter. Palate: light body, thin to bit oily texture with soft carbonation. Overall: Could recommend to everyone who likes stout style.
How : bottle Appearance : black with a small tanned head. Aroma : liquoroce, chocolate, wood, black berries, coffee and some caramel. Palate : medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle from Ales By Mail , enjoyed at Åserød. Pours black with a huge creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and liquorice, leather and weak smoke. Smooth creamy mouthfeel .Smooth taste as well, lovely dark roasted malts, moderate bitter liquorice, piney lingering hops at the finish, lovely stout.

Almost black with medium light brown creany head. Moderate roasted grain aroma. Medium bitter, moderate sour and slightly sweet. Strong roastes frain and chocolade notes. Short bitter aftertaste with chocolade notes.
Dark brown, almost black, transparent, small beige head. Smells coffee beans, barrel, alcohol. Sweet taste, medium to full body, gentle bitterness in the end. Perfect.
dark brown colour, medium sized dense beige head; aroma of chocolate, coffee, some soy sauce, some ash and hints of dried fruits;taste is the same with syrupy-honey-like sweetness; excellent stout!

Black with medium brown head. Aroma is butter coffee dried leaves cocoa honey maybe chocolate. Taste is smooth sweet chocolate with dark mild cofee bitterness. Incredibly drinkable and smooth with full body. Nice.
Draft at taphouse Munich. Pours black with beige head. Nose is roasted coffee, toast, dried fruit. Palate is smooth as fuck, coffee, Toffee, chocolate, dried fruit. Great stout.

lovely breakfast stout.

pours smooth, very black with little to no transparency. tan head, dissipating after a few minutes to the crema on an espresso.

coffee notes on the aroma, slightly petrol smell, chocolate liquor lingering.

chocolatey taste, lots of mid notes, slightly bitter but not assertively or unpleasantly so. well balanced. smooth and drinkable. the coffee notes build as you drink, building the bitterness over time

velvety mouthfeel, nice and thick, feels warming. no unpleasant bite.

very enjoyable beer

Butelka 330 ml. Barwa czarna, klarowna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana niska, beżowa, szybko opada. W zapachu z butelki bardzo wyraźny kwas chlebowy i paloność. Po nalaniu do szkła można też wyczuć gorzką oraz mleczną czekoladę i kakao. W smaku bardzo podobnie jak w aromacie, do tego niskie, ale bardzo przyjemne, delikatne, wręcz szampańskie wysycenie. Goryczka niska, identyczna w odczuciu z gorzkością kakao. Bardzo dobry stout.

Pours a short brown head with toasted bread aromas. Oil black body. Thick and round in mouth on a high concentration of roasted malts and coffee.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lukt: Kaffe, sjokolade og vanilje.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Kaffe, lakris, sjokolade og vanilje.
Hvor: Mellombesl, Bryne..

Bottle shared at the March THT. Pours close to black, tan head. Fresh coffee, milk chocolate, roasted malts. Medium sweet, medium bitter.

Bottle shared at THT. Almost black with nice dark beige head. Lots of fresh coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts, oatmeal, light toffee. Light sweet and bitter. Just medium bodied with slick feel. Very nice.
Draft - Coffee, dark chocolate and nice roast. Jet black with a rich light brown head. Dark sweet chocolate, rich coffee and a silky smooth finish. Very nice.
330ml bb16016 g740. Poured black with thick subsiding head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Taste milk chocolate. Quite sweet with appropriate bitterness. An enjoyable sweet stout.
Pours black with a medium tan head. Aroma is coffee and vanilla. A nice stout, roasted malts, coffee and nice vanilla finish, like a latte.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of mild coffee, roasted malts, some dark chocolate. Black with tan head. Taste is light sweet and moderate- bitter. Full body, oily- feel and roasted finish.

Aroma: Coffee, roasted malts, hint of vanilla.
Taste: Coffee. Roast. Coffee. 
Ok, not too great.

1/2 pint on tap @ One Pint Pub. Pours cloudy dark brown with a high tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with coffee. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, a hint of vegetables and some hops. Decent if a bit disappointing.
Tasting glass at Man in the moon. Pours black with little head. Cocoa and coffee taste with cocoa aroma.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Broken Dream Breakfast Stout by Siren Craft Brew at Konstruktorska Business CenterMocno zbozowo-kawowy, nieco czekoladowy, ciut waniliowy, ciut alko, slodki, gladki, niewysoko wysycony, dosc lekki, smaczny mocno :) Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Decent sized fluffy mushroom coloured head on a near-black body. Aroma, taste and texture all full of oats. On the nose, coffee and chocolate take the lead but the flavour is more cereal dominated. Not too sweet.

330ml bottle. Pours black. Aroma is earthy, with nuts, coffee, porridge. Flavour starts with coffee, leads into toast, nuts and cornflakes and finishes with tart bitter orange. Not as smooth as you might expect. Pretty nice.

330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6.5%. Black colour, moderate to low tan head. Aroma of dark malts, cold coffee, dark chocolate and unsweetened cocoa, hints of woodwork, smoke and spices. The flavour is dry and roasty with notes of coffee, wood and smoke,

on tap dark medium head coffee liquorice cocoa medium body
scura discreta schiuma media persistenza caffe filo liquirizia cacao discreto corpo cacao

Bottle. It pours black with a creamy beige head. The aroma is creamy lacto like chocolate and roasted malts. Light coffee. Roasted flavor with some hoppy and chocolate notes. Coffee notes in the finish.
Bottle. Dark brown, close to black, fine tan foam. Aroma: coffee, roasted, chocolate and caramel sweet. Taste: soft, sweet, coffee, slightly creamy, a little chocolate, medium hop bitterness.

Bottle at home. In the beggining black colour and beautiful one inch high light brown head. Armas of milky chocolate and cappucino in the beggining and some bad aromas of decomposing fruits behind them. Its not really strong but its bit disturbing. In flavor again milk chocolate, cappucino but theres also nuts and lil bit of smokiness probably from dark malts. Really weak bitterness (level of pilsner/lager) for me but it had to be breakfast stout so its fit to name really good.

6.5%ABV. Stout.

Poured out black. 40ºSRM.

Nose has cacao, chocolate, coffee and light woodsmoke. Clean and inviting.

Mouthfeel is light and almost beery. Palate is roasted barley. Charcoal. Burnt toast. hint of dark fruit at the end.

Finish is charcoal, burnt twig bitter.

33cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Zwart met een donkerbruine schuimkraag. G: Pure chocolade, koffie, lactose en wat vanilletoetsen. S: Koffie, cacao en geroosterde mout. Een wat vreemde zoete-lactose afdronk. M: Medium body met lichte carbonatie. Sticky.

DWF; Bottle 330ml, drunk at Cardinal. Pours a moderate to large, black with a creamy, lacing tan head. Nose is moderate to heavy, roasted, malt, coffee, moderate chocolate and dark dried fruit. Taste is heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a lasting, coffee, chocolate, warming finish. Body is full, texture is oily to creamy , carbonation is flat to soft.
DWF Brunt tett skum. aroma av kaffe malt karamell. Smak masse kaffe. Brent. Kanongod.

Cask @ The Craft Brewery co. Black. Coffee, sugar, burnt malt. Coffee, chocolate, faint smoke. A really well balanced stout. Smooth, slightly watery with a long, cocoa finish. A really kick-ass stout and cask to boot!

Niewielka piana, szybko opadająca do chmurki. Barwa ciemno brązowa, nieprzejrzysta. Piwo pachnie przyjemnie kawą, lodami czekoladowymi, ciastem kakaowym... W smaku słodkie, wyraźna kawa, zarówno świeżo palone ziarna jak i espresso, mleczna czekolada, kakao, nieduża palona goryczka. Lekko szorstkie i pijalne w odbiorze.

Kolejne dobre piwo od piwowarów z Siren.

Bottle from Brothers Beer in Auckland. Darkest brown pour with a small beige head. Aroma is nice, coffee and dark chocolate, hints of smoke and earth. Flavor is earthy, charcoal, chocolate, roast. Mild sweetness and a bitter finish. Medium-plus bodied, slick and smooth. Pretty nice, but not a standout.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pous dark brown with nice brown head, sadly doesnt stay. Aroma: coffee, roasted, milk chocolate, peas, weak smoke. Taste: sweet with gentle bitterness, milk chocolate with milk coffee, roasted bitterness, smooth oat. Medium body. Smooth to drink. Long roasted- bitter milk chocolate finish. Nice one.
Tap at small pub in Brentford. Deep dark colour with small head off. Aroma of nuts, coffee. Taste of roasted coffee, malts, dried fruits, chocolate. Great!
Excellent Stout. Pretty intense aroma and flavour. Good coffee notes. Overall, exquisite.

Pikzwart met beige schuimkraag die vrij snel wegvalt. In de geur komt heel sterk melk en koffie naar voren. De smaak is als een koffie met veel melk. De chocoladetoetsen maken dat het bier een licht bittere nasmaak heeft.

330 ml bottle served cool in a Hoegaarden snifter. Black body, thin tan head. Principal aroma is flat white coffee. Flavour of Mocha, with muted smoke and liquorice. Velvety mouth feel. I dont wish to appear mealy-mouthed about a very good beer, but I feel it falls just short of greatness.

Fra flaske på årets siste Mi2, Cardinal des-16: brunsvart med flott skum. Mmm, dette er godsaker - rund og balansert med mørk sjokolade, kvalitetskaffe, mørk karamell og litt lakris. Mild, lekker bitterhet i ettersmaken. 6,5 på Richters skala.

Ebony with a minimal beige head, no lacing. Aroma is strong coffee and roasted malts. Taste is on the bitter side, very coffeeish, roasted malts, some chocolate. Medium body, low carbonation and a lingering bitter finish. Typical for its style, good, linear, nothing amazing, good homework.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 19.12.16. Ebony. Not much head or lacing. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, liquorice, herbs, cough medicine and vanilla. Evident alcohol and moderate bitterness. Low drinkability.

Pours almost black with good beige head with fair retention. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and a slight hint of smoke. Taste on the sweet side, but well balanced, roasted malts, caramel malts and again with chocolate and coffee to the forefront. Not as clinging a mouthfeel as the heavier stouts, and a bit watery texture. Smooth drinking with a long aftertaste. Good stout but for me a little on the sweet side to be up there with the greats.

Pours black with a short lived head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts with some slight burnt notes. Quite a smooth mouthful with the milk, chocolate, some coffee and a sweetness to the taste that ends on a slightly bitter note. Very enjoyable.
Dark and opaque with minimal head. Strong aroma of coffee and chocolate syrup. Smooth and sweet but not syrupy, lovely hint of smoke. Very velvety mouthfeel without being thick. This is exceptional.
Pours black, opaque. Small brown head, quickly dissipates. Deep coffee grounds aroma. Silky mouthfeel. Flavor is reminiscent of hot chocolate.

Taste is sweet malty with caramel, dark bread, caramel and chocolate with dried fruity notes and a complex milky texture. Finish is sweet but balanced malty and complex.
Cask @ Inn Deep. Almost black, not much head. Resin treacle coffee chocolate aroma. Sweet earthy coffee flavour. Smooth with sweet coffee aftertaste. Not really my sort of beer.

Bottle 33cl. poured into a pint. Opaque deep dark brown, small frothy tan head, good retention and lacing; aroma roasted malts, cocoa, dark fruits, light smoke; smooth taste, light heavy sweet and light bitter, malty, chocolate, coffee, mocha, retronasal smoke; malty sweetbitter aftertaste, chocolate, fruity touch; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; rich and round stout, superb.

On tap at Luppolo Station in Rome-Italy. Dark brown/black pour, ivory dark foam. Nose: chocolate, milk, very balanced. Mouth: watery and complex, incredible. Some milky cocoa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black pour, with a slight mocha head that recedes to a lacing. Sugary vanilla malt aroma. Has a light character for a stout, but theres plenty of malts, smokiness, coffee, and cream/milk that it doesnt feel thin in flavour - just makes it quite drinkable. Excellent stout!

Keg at Redwillow Bar, Macclesfield. 6.7% ABV. A deep brown to black colour with no head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, milk chocolate, some cocoa, slight burnt caramel, a little oat, and subtle smoke. Taste of roasted malts, coffee, milk chocolate, some burnt caramel, slight liquorice and subtle smoke. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A sweetish, caramelly, chocolatey bitterness in the finish. A really nice breakfast stout, not too heavy. A little sweet compared to most but a lovely array of flavours.
Draught at Bierhaus, Cork. Deep mahogany with a filmy, tan head. SWeet milk and burnt coffee aroma. Slightly sweet chocolate and coffee. Not too cloying.
Soft and gentle, with sweet sugar and licorice and slight burnt notes which leads to a dry finish
Frisch vom Hahn bei BrewDog Berlin. Tiefes Schwarz mit leichter Schaumkrone. Ein Traum von einem Stout. Milde Kaffeenoten.

33cl bottle from ales by mail. Dark color. Thin brown head. Medium thick very smooth body. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roasted, molasses, caramel, herby, cinnamon, milk. Very very good.
SPb Craft Weekend. Розлив. Ничего особенн& ни в аромате ни во вкусе не увидел, довольн& проходн& стаут.

On tap @ Whats Brewing, Stavanger. Pours black, with a small creamy, off white head. Aroma is dark roasted malts, with coffee, leather and liquorice. Full body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is dark roasted malts, with bread, chocolate and leather.

Tap. Pitch black color. Small size, tan head, stays. Coffee, roast, herbal hops, bit milky in aroma. Coffee, roast, herbal hops, bit of beans in taste. Roast and coffee in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Roasty bitterness. Alcohol is hidden. Excellent brew.Earlier Rating: 3/25/2016 Total Score: 3.7330ml bottle. Very dark brown color. Small size, brown head, stays. Roasted malts, coffee, sweetish, grainy in aroma. Roasted malts, bit smokey, chocolate and milky in taste. Long lasting roast and sweet chocolate in aftertaste. Nice and mellow. Excellent brew!

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma has nice, dark chocolaty malts, coffee and quite a lot of smoke? Heavy oats and dark malts. Taste is pretty sweet up front, coffee and dark chocolate gets taken over by a dry smoke, finishing rather bitter. Average carbonation and a smooth body.

On tap: pours black color, clear, with tan light brown head. Aroma: rich dark malt aroma, with noses of coffee, cacao powder, dark chocolate. Flavor: intense malt flavor, with notes, mentiined above, supported with gentle smokey, or better ashey note, some dark fruits...finish is dry. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation is low to medium.
Duft ristet brød ristet malt chokolade sød karamel kakao smag ristet malt chokolade svag rustet malt sød kaffe eftersmag

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours pitch black with a small creamy brown head. Aromas of fudge, subtle smoke, ash, chocolate, malt, dark fruits, brown sugar. Taste is malty, sweet chocolate, dark fruits, milkish sweetness, fudge, subtle smoke, not a lot of roast if anything, some fruity coffee.
East of Everything ontap(13-Oct-16)Berry Light choc aroma.Black,cream head&spider lace.Berry choc herbal flavour.Caramel berry finish&herbal roast choc aftertaste.

Dark brown color with brownish head. Aroma is sweet and malty with milk chocolate and a bit of caramel. Taste is quite interesting. It has a slight acrid taste specific to roasted malts but overall its really chocolaty and milky sweet. Aftertaste lingers with a nice coffee note and a light bitterness. Full bodied and smooth. This is a really good breakfast stout, I really dig this style.

Slightly roasted malts with tar and bit of plum. Soft and balanced. Overall, bit light but good for the percentage.

A deep dark stout with a thin dark brown head. In aroma, nice intense chocolate with vanilla notes, light dark fruits, molasses, very nice and graceful. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity chocolate malt with vanilla, light coffee, molasses, dark fruits, alcohol warmth, very nice and lingering. On tap at Tap Ale Project.

Bottle from Ledgers. It pours a dark brown/black color with a small light brown head. The aroma with roasted malt, cocoa and coffee up front with more subtle notes of smoke, brown sugar and sweet fig/raisin dark fruitiness. Good complex stout aroma. The flavor has a good amount of tartness with more fig, red grape, raisin, smoke, chocolate and some coffee mainly in the finish. Although mild, theres some nice burnt sugar and hard roasted bitterness in the finish. The body is fairly light and very tart for the style. Pretty good overall.

Tap at Murphys Law. Opaque black with fluffy tan head. Big deep roasted chocolate malts, hints of coffee, blueberry fruitiness, light rotting wood/green coffee/berry sourness. Over medium sweet with very light sour and medium bitter. Medium body, cocoa powder dry texture, average carbonation. Soft vanilla silky feel and finish.
On tap at Armakeggon 2016. The deep roasted aromas and flavours that run through this make it a special beer.

The beer has got a deep black colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma of coffee and bitter chocolate. Taste of roasted malt, dark bread, cappuccino, dark coffee, cream, woods and chocolate. Hints of torf. Delicious.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 5/17/2017. Pours opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, toasted oats, dark bread, molasses, vanilla, cream, raisin, plum, cherry, fig, light smoke, slight herbal, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of roast/bready malt, coffee, lactose, and moderate fruity yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of big dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, toasted oats, dark bread, molasses, vanilla, cream, raisin, plum, cherry, fig, light smoke, slight herbal, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, toasted oats, dark bread, molasses, vanilla, cream, dark fruit, light smoke, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt, coffee, lactose, and moderate fruity yeast flavors; with a great roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from roast bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/silky, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 6.5%. Overall this is an excellent coffee milk stout! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of roast/bready malt, coffee, lactose, and moderate fruity yeast flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Black pour with a tan head which settles nicely to a tight, half cm thickness. Roasty, coffee, cocoa aromas. Taste is nice black coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, slightly sweet at the start then finishes like a nice milky iced coffee.
Wow cracking drink pours like black coffee with tan fading to crema head lovely velvety texture with coffee and dark chocolate taste one to savour.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.

A: Black / Negro.
T/S: Roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice / Malta tostada, chocolate, regaliz.
Great bonfire smoke notes on the aroma, with a clean tasting finish. A good beer, need to hunt down one of the BA versions.
Draught at Brewdock. Deep black with a thin tan head. Aroma is creamy vanilla malt. Flavour is coffee, liquorice, dark chocolate, creamy bitter base. Smoky roast finish.
Bottle from BottleDog. Pour is black with a caramel head, aroma is toffee, roast malts, milk chocolate. Taste is milk chocolate, lactose, roast malts, gentle bitterness. Good stuff

Aroma: bitter chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, burnt barley, rum, red dried fruits.
Appearance: dark color, nice beige/brown thin head.
Taste: low bitterness (herbs), bitter chocolate, roasted dark malts, coffee, burnt barley, smooth texture.

Overall: Great stout, really smooth, intensive roasted notes with coffee, recommended.

On draft, as a stout this one is a stand out. Pours a traditional deep brown to black, thick rocky off white head. Inviting aroma of dark chocolate and vanilla, some butterscotch. Taste is very much the dark chocolate up front. Middle of the mouth comes the vanilla and chocolate cream and finishes smooth. Really a triumph of brewing a bold beer without a bold abv.

Bottle at home from mchughs. The lighter sibling to the wonderful shattered dreams. This lives up to the expectation. Pours black with fluffy tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, liquorice, leather, slightly sour milk. Smooth creamy sweet dry coffee flavour. Carbonation is pitched just right. Full bodied. Great sweet lower abv stout.
Tap at Local Pub, Athens. Color black with small tan head. Aroma roasted, malt, some caramel. Taste bittersweet, roasted, coffee, chocolate.

Sweetness, chocolate, and coffee in the aroma. The taste is the same. Very light in taste to drink anyways. Lovely bitterness that fills the mouth for a long while. Wonderful beer to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Aroma: chocolate, roasty, coffee, smoky, bready
Taste: sweet, low bitterness, roasty, chocolate, smoky, bready

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks Nir A. for this bottle! Black-colored with a nice brown head. Big roasty and smoky aroma with some coffee, lactose and some cocoa notes. Lovely roasty and smoky flavor, slightly sweet, with a lactose touch. Medium-bodied. Very good.

Bottle at 6.5% ABV. Gloopy chestnut body. Violet mocha thin head. Nose is chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, hops. meat, smoke, iron, freshly baked bread, lemon. Taste is smoky and savoury. Dry finish. Soft mouthfeel. Creamy oats in the mouthfeel. Very good.
Bottle at Drygate. Good stuff. Chocolate, coffee, light creaminess. Lots of taste, lots of roast. Easy to drink though. Rich and lightly fruity. Nice.

330ml bottle. pours an opaque black with tanned head. aroma is of coffee and bitter cocoa. velvety smooth mouth feel. perfect amount of medium carbonation - mild coffee notes and cocoa after taste. could drink this all day.

Breakfast stout? At 6.5%. That's a breakfast worth writing home about!! Pours really nicely. Like thin liquid treacle. Nice creamy head. Quite syrupy. Very sweet smelling.

Bottle whilst watching match of the day with the rabbit. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of creamed coffee an a touch of burned sugar. Full flavour. Roast malt and dried fruit sweetness. Coffee and chocolate. Dryish and somewhat sweet finish. Very nice.

Bottle from Vesuvio in Darlington. Pours black with a nice tan head. Nice chocolate and coffee aroma. The taste has a little sharpness too it before silkie chocolate and coffee comes through. Great aftertaste. Its just a little light in body. Very nice stuff.
Pours a black colour. Taste is of liquorice, roast malts and some coffee. Pretty good beer

Bottle tall boys beer market Leeds. Black head lie retention. Aroma is nice sweet choc coffee roasted notes. Taste is sweet milky choc coffe bitters good roasted smokey dark malts. Ok body. Good stuff.

Bottle home. Pours an opaque black with a small off-white head. Sweet with aromas of toasted malts and dark caramel. Alook hints of charred bbq-dinner. Tiny hints og dried fruits. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with more roasted malts.

Tap, Euston Tap, London. Following a 10 minute heat-up the beer unravels pleasant roast and malty notes in aroma, elegantly entwined with some solid chocolate and coffee punch with a touch of dryness on the palate. At large, one odd the most balanced beers i have ever had pleasure to dive into
Its been a while since I had this one so I dont really remember its characteristics. it was a very nice beer though

14/XI/14 - 33cl bottle @ Sannes birthday tasting (Gent) - BB: VI/2015 (2014-1318) Thanks to ElManana for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, small creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. aroma: lots of coffee, charcoal, very roasted, cocoa powder, bit sweet. MF: soft carbon, medium body, creamy texture. Taste: very roasted, lots of coffee, caramel, bit sweet, soft hoppiness, charcoal. Aftertaste: roasted, bitter hops, lots of coffee, dry, coffee grit. Decent, but not my favourite.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Helsinki, Colour is almost black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Chocolate, some coffee and roasted malts. Very nice and gentle.

33 cl bottle (6,5%) @ VastActiv
Aroma has licorice, some coffee and peaty tones. Flavour has salty licorice, some coffee and coffee. The salty licorice is rather dominant here. Too salty but still rather enjoyable. Could not locate the smoke here.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 Bottle at home. Pours black. Roasted malt, espresso and chocolate aroma. Flavour is caramel, chocolate, espresso and dark fruits. Sweet and mildly bitter taste. Rich texture. She definitely drew me toward a land of flavour, reverie and colour.. phenomenal.
Pours black with a beige head. Nose is coffee, dark chocolate, espresso, smokiness. Taste is bitter chocolate and coffee. Aftertaste lasts long. Great stout.

Pitch black, 1 finger espresso head that fades fast.im gonna enjoy this rating because in almost every beer I have, I can taste or smell broken dreams. Nose has a little chipotle pepper, milk chocolate, pepper and the classic roasted ashy malts. The taste is a really nice mix of heart disease, unemployment and broken dreams. Yet, very refreshing. Wish it had more body.

Bottle from Beersiveknown (European swap 7.0), thank you Steve. Pours nearly black color, beige head. Aroma of strong coffee, caramel, roasted malt. Taste is medium bitter, lightly sweet, coffee, burnt sugar, caramel, roasted malt. Coffee finish.

good as hell. all the best things that come from dark malts are right here. it looks beautiful too, and just look at the bottle - fabulous. i could drink this beer with my eyes only. simply delicious. drawbacks? aroma could be a bit more intense, and the beautiful brown foam disappears quickly. but it;s nothing.

33cl bottle. 
The beer is smooth and oily. Aroma is not very intensive but reveals torrified notes like black chocolate. Some cheese and ashes. Taste is neither intensive but well balanced and satisfying. Nothing extraordinary comparing to many other stouts I had this evenning but its still a good one.

Schöner feiner, leicht bräunlicher Schaum. In der Nase ganz viel Malz, Schokolade und Kaffeebohnen. Im Antrunk süßlich, dann öffnen sich Aromen von Kakao, Karamell, Kaffee, Vanille und etwas Nougat. Lang anhaltende süße im Abgang, angenehm herber Nachklang von Kakao und Espresso. Sehr schönes Stout

From tap at HomoSibaris, Barcelona. Black color with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malty, chocolate and light coffee. Taste is sweet and bitter, milk chocolate and coffee. Medium to light body, oily, soft carbonation

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Keg at the Blue Moon, Cambridge. I dislike breakfast stouts as a style. Theyre hard to pull off, normally too much coffee, not enough beer. Pointless really. However Ryan bucks the trend (again) for me and produces something both subtle and bold. Its opaque dark brown with a laudable tan head. Aroma not up to all that much: a bit of smoky coffee but nothing earth shattering. Then theres the taste. Simultaneously sweet, sour, bitter and herby. Raw coffee, rice vinegar, coriander, bitter chocolate, a hint of vegetable and soy. Finish is a bitter-sour espresso hit with hints of green banana and blackberry. Wow.
Draft at Churchkey. Black color, fluffy brown head with good retention and solid lacing. Aroma of rich chocolatey cocoa powder and coffee. Taste is espresso and moccha. Very nice.
quite stable beige head. coffee coloured. aroma is earthy, coffee, roasted nuts, bit milksugar. taste like aroma with a fair roasted bitterned. quite dense body, medium carbonation.  bottle 33cl

Wonderful stout. Great touch of smokiness with dark chocolate and a little coffee. Some oaty breakfast aroma. Pours black with good head and lacing. Light sweet and bitter finish. Great package and awesome balance. Another score for siren.

Bottle. Nose is strong latte, cream, chocolate. Taste follows, with latte, hint of smoke, chocolate, plums, lactose, a lasting slightly too sweet finish. Mouthfeel is velvet. 

A really nice stout that is a touch too sweet.

Black with a thin tan head. Aroma of roast malt, coffee, chocolate, milk, oats, a little smoke. Taste is sweet with a light bitter finish. Texture is thin/medium oily,low/medium carbonation. Really nice.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Keg at Euston Tap. Dark pour, brown, thin tan head. Dark, lush chocolate and coffer flavours, big body, heavy mouthfeel, long complex dark finish. This brewer is awesome.

Tap @ Flandes. Black coloured, with a medium sized black head. Nose is roasted malts, coffee, coffee cream, bit of chocolate. Flavour is roasted malts, coffee, coffee cream, hint of vanilla sweetness.

Bottle thanks to richthevillan, thanks Richy. Black beer with small tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and some dark fruits. Taste is some smoke, roasted coffee, chocolate and dark fruits. Medium bodied. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
0,33 l bottle 
cereal, chocolate, coffee, toast, roasty, brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, light sweetness, very bitter, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

330 ml bottle at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Black color, brown head. Aromas of roasted coffee and vanilla. Taste of bitter chocolate, rcoffee, some roasted and vanilla, not so intense though. Medium to full body with low carbonation.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2014 Bouteille 33cl @Huens. Voilà un beau Stout comme on sy attend: riche, dense et assez savoureux qui offre un beau nez épicé avec de lorge grillé, du malt torréfié, un soupçon de vanille, un pointe de fumé, du sucre réglissé. On tap at Frisco Tap House & Brewery in Columbia, MD. 

Opaque, brown-black with a tan head and good to very good lacing. 

Aroma of dark chocolate, caramel, roasted malt, mocha and dark fruit. 

Taste of dark chocolate, mocha, roasted malt, caramel and dark fruit. 

Full/medium body and medium carbonation with a nice mouthfeel.

Pours jet black with a tan head that fades to lacing. Very little aroma. Some cocoa and toffee sweetness. Flavour is far superior to the aroma. Super smooth texture. Some oats, milk, coffee, cocoa and a roasted barley finish. Some liquorice character
330ml bottle from The Wine Emporium 260614. Big creamy brown head of brown foam atop a big black beer. Sweet and burnt aroma.

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a really solid black with a thick dark tan head that subsides to a cap. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee beans, black coffee, smoke, stewed fruit (prunes, dates) and cocoa powder. Taste is black coffee and cocoa at the front before a huge roasted, smoky bitterness washes through. Some dark fruit and chocolate comes through towards the end. Doesnt fall off at all. Lingering dark chocolate and fruity finish. A really top notch stout.

Small to no head dark pour medium carbonation aromas roast coffee bean cocoa dark chocolate caramel mild liquorice the flavours roast coffee caramel medium bitter cocoa dried fruit liquorice full body taste to this stout lovely roast coffee bean taste the finish best tastes roast sweet malts nice finish of bitter roast dry cocoa very nice
Cask at the Red Squirrel. Roasted chocolate and coffee on nose, sweet and thin, dry roast coffee, sweet chocolate.

Noire profond, mousse hyper discrète, beige. Très légère carbonation, parfaitement adaptée. Au nez, le cacao, la torréfaction et une touche "lactose" dominent. La bouche confirme vraiment le nez. Le palais laisse une belle touche entre cacao et caramel en plus de la torréfaction.
Very smooth drinking, strong chocolate and coffee aroma, repeated in the taste.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Watery, some roastiness to it, very earthy with a leaf hop taste... Challenger or something? Its not very slick, but very light, the roastiness dominates and only other malt taste that goes through is some licorice. More oats, less roasted barley, more chocolate malt.
Bottle.Black colour with medium off-beige head.Aroma is mild smoked and rosted with taste of chocolate and coffee,smooth with medium body and creamy mild flavour of coffee and roosted caramel.

Bottle. Black with a small tan head that never quite disappears. Aroma of mocha, dark berries, smoke, simmered milk. Medium bodied, silky. More bright coffee flavours than heavier, roasty ones. Milky chocolate, vanilla. Smoke pretty much disappears. Sweet with a little coffee acidity and vanilla at the end. Good, with something subtly compelling about it.
No soy muy de stout pero esta me gusta. Compleja y amarga. Pasas y café. Final amargo. Rica.
Bouteille 33cl. Stout riche et complexe, faible carbo, absence de mousse. Nez dominé par le café et les malts grillés. Arômes de café fort, avoine, touche de vanille. Bon.

Black, no head; the aroma of dark chocolate and raisins follows through to the taste; some roast malt; quite bitter, slightly sweet; the stand out feature is the smooth, silky, velvety mouthfeel which makes this an absolute pleasure.

Sample thx to Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, mocha, vanilla, lots of coffee!
TASTE: coffee, vanilla, mocha.

Bottle at home. Almost black with a thick brown head. Smells of coffee and roasted malt. Roast taste, medium to full body. Feels smooth in the mouth but I can also feel a bit of acid in it. Nice stout that is pretty low in alcohol.
Jet black with thin tan head. Sweet. Aroma of roasted malts. Slightly oily palate. A bit thin but a good finish.

On tap, 6.7 % abv, at Søernes Ølbar, shared with Skinnyviking. Moderate, tan-coloured head. Jet black body. Earthy malts and sweet liquorice aromas. Brown and black malty flavours, hints of both black coffee, liquorice and chocolate, ashy dry. Malt bitter ending. Fine bodied. Good drinking (Copenhagen 01.05.2014).

Tried this at severeal occasions, rated form tap @ Søernes Ølbar. Lovely black pour with a nice brown head. Aroma is dominated by coffee and cocoa beans, roasted malts (almost like sticking your nose in a sack of chocolate malt), a very subtle smoked notes, actually an ashy-tobacco-like smoked note. The taste is predominantly malty with a very well balanced residual sweetness. Dark fruits and coffee from the malts, light cocoa and smoke notes. Very full bodied for 6% alcohol - nice residual sweetness. Solid as a rock.

Dark brown almost black espresso colour with tinny head. Smells really roasted and coffeeish. Soft and roast palate at the same time. Can be taken instead of coffee in the morning, thats why the name, I guess ...

Cask at the Reading beer festival. Dark brown. Chocolate up front with sweet malty roasty notes, a little coffee and some sherry. Pleasant enough but somehow lacked oomph and didnt quite do enough for me.

Bouteille 33cl, merci Nico. BB 12/2013.
De couleur noire, col crémeux, moka, doré au verre.
Arôme offre un bouquet profond malté, note crystal sur un léger nasal amer venant des houblons. Touche poussiéreuse. 
Palais est généreux au niveau du caractère malté, belle note de grillé, chocolat avec une pointe de café. Le tout est sec et poussiéreux dans un style très anglais. Certaine épaisseur est offerte par lavoine. Pointe de citronné houblonné apparait en fin de bouche. Amertume est agréable et rajoute à ce caractère anglais.

Draught @ Fermentoren,Århus.Pours black with a small light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate. Flavor is malts, mild coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate. Medium body, average carbonation, dry roasted finish.260414

330ml bottle. Pitch black colour with late awakening, huge, thick, creamy, fully lasting, moderately lacing, tan head (somewhat familiar characterisation of a Siren brew, ha ha). Roasty dark malty aroma has notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, a very cautious smoky touch. Taste is dark malty, subtle sweetness, hints of mocha, milk and dark chocolate; slightly sticky palate.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Almost black, fine brown head. Aroma is liquorice, roasted coffee beans, and some burnt caramel. The taste has a high bitterness and low sweetness. Coffee and chocolate flavours dominate. Surprisingly rich and sticky on the palate, considering the low abv.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, medium sweet, caramel, hop, liquorice, hop, little dry and medium bitter.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Dark brown almost pitch black, small off white head, okay lacing. Aroma, roasted malts, lots of coffee, bitter dark chocolate, molasses, . Taste, roasted malts, coffee, malt, molasses, liquorice, dark fruits, . Dry mouth feel. Roasted malts with a nice bitterness in the finish. Really nice stout.

Aroma: toasted malts, bread malts. Appearance: black with big frothy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: sweets intensify, caramel, chocolate, toasted malts. Overall: great Stout, nice palate. Pint at Euston Tap, London.
Bottle. A big inviting coffee and chocolate aroma. Sadly the flavour doesnt live up to the aroma - flat coffee with some ash. Really lacks body for the ABV and style.

Bottedd. Pors black with a small, lacing and tan head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Sweet fflavor that ends up dry with bitter notes. Medium bodied, oily text. A nice stout indeed.

Bottle into Ass Clown snifter. Pours rich total black, thinning creamy tan head, nice lacing on the grass. Beautiful milky, coffee, malt chocolate aromas, but I am picking up very light egg and bananna. Low bitterness, mid sweet, light liquorice, faint chocolate. Id say fairly thin texture. Easy to drink and Id like to pair this with a nice cheesecake as suggest by the brewer, not something Id drink by itself and be overly amazed at.
Cask @ Old Gate, Hebden Bridge. Full-bodied, black with a large creamy brown head. Its very deep with its chocolate and coffee aromas and flavours and very tasty for it. Smoky in its aftertaste.

Black color with brown head, which disappear quickly but lacing glass. Nice aroma: dark chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, dried fruits, a bit smoky. Well-balanced taste, semi sweet with nice bitterness in the finish. Notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, dried fruits. Medium body with medium carbonation. Really solid and decent Stout.

On tap in a pint glass. Pours black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, some light chocolate and coffee notes, hints of smoke, and some dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend. Average texture. A pretty good beer.
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 330ml bottle from Grumpy Goat Reading. Very dark brown colour, brown head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, and sweet, and the taste is the same. Great beer.
chocolate, coffee, roasty, floral, black, cloudy, frothy, white foam, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish,
Cask, Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa. Dark brown. Bubbly head. Aroma has honey, coffee and a touch of roast. Lots of coffee, touch of chocolate. Light, acidic cask character.

Cask @ HomoSibaris, Barcelona 

Pours pitch black wirh a thick bubbly head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, ash, licorice and hops. Taste is silky smooth, but roasty and complex with notes of dark chocolate, licorice, ash and coffee. Finish is smooth, roasty and hoppy with licorice notes. Quite excellent real ale stout.

Draught. Low floffy quickly disappearing off-white head. Pitch black body. Sweet sugar roasted malt choccolate coffee aroma and flavor with little hops bitterness. Low carbonation and a long sweet finish.
Keg at Flying Elk, Stockholm.  Black, beige head. Aroma of chocolate and tar. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Molasses and caramel. Low-medium bitterness.

Draught, small stable bubly brown head with some lacing, pitch black colour, aroma of strong roasted aromatic coffee, carob, dried figs and dark caramel, flavour is a blend of aromatic coffee and dark chocolate, medium bodied and very smooth, making this extremly easy to drink. Very good.

color negro con reflejos caoba y espuma beige fina y duradera. Aromas lupulados, ligeramente afrutados, con tostados. Inicio en boca algo dulce y afrutado con final amargo equilibrado, aunque dura poco. La textura se me hace algo ligera. Con todo, bastante rica.
Smell is dark malt and a touch of smoke. Taste is slightly more intense smoke with a pleasant chocolate, coffee and roasted malt character.
Overall: Coffee, smoke, cured meat.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2014-02-22.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Köpenhamn 7/2-2014. Kaffebönor och rostad malt, choklad, söt, karamellmalt, medelbeska. Lång söt avslutning.

Chocolatey, malty aroma, followed by a lovely mellow, vaguely creamy mouthfeel. Extremely smooth overall, doesnt betray its ABV. Great appearance, rich brown with little head and no lingering bubbles. This is fantastic, my dreams remain unbroken.
@Fermentoren, Köpenhamn. Härlig doft och smak av kaffe, bra munkänsla samt ok beska. Mycket bra och smakrik Stout.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Pours completely black with a small, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma has cocoa, light coconut, hazelnuts, coffee, soft roasted. Medium carbonation, fine light creamy and light dry mouthfeel. Flavour is elegant, chocolate, coffee, hazelnuts, light salty. Mild roasted astringency. Lingering fairly powerful bitterness from both hops and malts. Nice balan
Draught @ Fermentoren. Black with a beige head. Aroma of cocoa and roasted malts. Sweet cocoa flavour, roasted malts and a good bitter finish. Lovely.
Draught @ C4, Odense. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Creamy and smooth. Dry and bitter. Mild ash, chocolate and licorice.

On tap at Christian Firtal. Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma of caramel, dark malts and dried fruit, with a touch of hops. Sweet flavour of dark chocolate and caramel, with a note of fresh ground coffee beans. Soft, velvet mouth feel
Cask @ Manchester Beer & Cider Festival Jan 14. A rich, flavoursome stout with lots of dusty cocoa and roasted coffee beans. Silky sweet in parts with a nice bitterness. Very nice.

text: 330ml bottle, pours black with a small off white head. Chocolate & roast coffee & cream. Full bodied and rich with a short and balanced chocolate cream aftertaste. Very nice.
Bottle at Örebro Ölcafé. Coffee and chocolate on the nose, I also get something that reminds me of chili but is most likely a coffee-aroma that plays tricks on me. Very nice beer!

Botella de 33 cl en cimmeria 24-01-2014. al momento. Color negro con espuma algo oscura bastante fina y cremosa y duradera. Cuerpo bastante cremoso y suave medio muy agradable de beber. Sabores tostados café y cacao. Bastante buena, para repetir sin problema

330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 
In short: a viscous spicy stout.
Pours black with very tan head. Some head retention and lacing. Roasty, coffee, some liquor and spicy aromas. Medium body, silky texture, soft carbonation. Taste is roasty,some vanilla, spicy, chocolate, coffee, some creamy flavours, A knid of subtle hot taste. Sweet aftertaste. Very enjoyable.

Draught @ Craft Beer Co - Islington, 55 White Lion Street, Islington, Greater London, England N1 9PP.Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130327]

As smooth as smooth can be. Velvety alright. A little on the sweet side with milk chocolate from the malt. Rounded backbone from the hops. Not sharp at all. Goes down far too easily. This is a classic stout done incredibly well.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2014 On tap @ Haket Pub. Very dark brown with a small brown head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, coffee, smoke, caramel and hops. Medium body with a nice, bitter sweet finish.

On tap @ Beer Temple. A big really hard to get rid of dense and dark looking head on top of a really dark cola black body. Smells heavy roasted and quite chocolate sweet! A bit like English chocolate without any further explanation on what English chocolate is. I quite like this aroma. It has a really nice gliding slick mouthfeel this and the carbonation level is way below average. Near flat in a way. Would not think so by looking at that lovely head. It has a good amount of Nesquick in the taste this. Sweet and loaded with lots of sugary chocolate. Not cloying cause it has a nice balance from the near grassy hops. Sweet licorice and a little bit of cardamom finishes this one off quite elegantly. Yeah, think this is my first from Siren, and Im really liking what Im having. 26.09.2013

On tap at the Red Squirrel. 
Appearance - opaque black with a decent fawn head. 
Nose - dark chocolate 
Taste - definitely dark chocolate then going into raisin possivky some nuttiness. 
Palate - dense in body and texture. Not refreshing om the finish but relatively balanced. 
Overall - lovely beer.

Cask Half Pint at White Horse Old Ale Festival 2013, Parsons Green, London in Nov 2013 - Apparently a "Breakfast Stout". Black in colour. Very Malty; roasty malts, roast coffee, chocolate, caramel, liquorice, vanilla and some smoke. Fruity; some dark fruits. Smooth. Sweetish roast malty coffee and chocolate throughout. Increasingly dry into the long finish. Enjoyed this a lot. Superb Stout!

On tap at Beer Temple. At 6.7% ABV according to the blackboard. Black colour, lovely creamy beige-brown head. Aroma of chocolate, brownies, coffee, cream. Flavour is medium-sweet, coffee, roast, chocolate, malts, nice bitter roast finish. Medium-bodied, creamy. Great stuff IMHO.
This is how a stout should be, thick, with a body of coffee and cacao. Bit milky as well, full beer. Nice.

Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Black pour with a tan head. Smoke and dark coffee roast aroma. Licorice toffee, dark roast coffee and demerara sugar flavour. Very smooth. Long, dry smoky finish. Very tasty. By Jove I like this one.

Bottle at home. Black pour, thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, bready yeast, licorice, chocolate and some ripe fruits. Flavor is smooth roasted malts, slightly bitter chocolate and with some espresso up front. Nice and well balanced brew.

Bottle, now 6.5%, pours deep black-brown with a fine coffee crema. Smoke and touches of coffee and treacle on the nose, body is smooth, dry and somehow milky, with coffee and tart red fruit, a little chocolate coming through, then light bitterness and burnt treacle in the finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2014 Dec 2013 - Cask.  Black with a brown head which endures, full lacing.  Smells yeasty.  Body medium, fairly smooth, low carbonation, just slightly foamy.  Taste up front is a bit watery, roasted barley, sickly sweet liquorice, watered down coffee. (3.5)
Nov 2014 - Keg at Draft House.  Black, small dense brown head, full lacing.  Aroma is all coffee bean.  Body is light, a bit foamy, low carbonation.  Taste is ashy, thin malt, some light coffee, no bitterness.  Decent enough.  (3.4)

Bottle- first dark Siren. Black treacle pour forming a slender tan collar. Bit of a generic rotting leaf, lactic, beef Monster Munch, wet dog English BC aroma. Nothing wrong with that. Soft leather, blue steak, grilled aubergine flavour rounded with warm milk and licked aluminium sweetness more dubbel than stout. Semi-dried black grapes. Thick soft condition. (Bloody) good but expected great.

Bottle, awesome label. Pours very dark brown with a small tanned head. Really nice aroma with lots of dark chocolate, some roasted malts and smoke. Taste also has chocolate, smoke and some coffee, but not as big as you would expect from the aroma. Medium body and soft carbo.

Bottle @SBWF 2013
Opaque brown/black color, brown head. Medium-bodied. Chocolate, caramel, sweetish and liquerish. Nice brew.

(Cask at White Horse, Parsons Green, London, 22 Nov 2013) Black colour with brief, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Malty, roasted taste with notes of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, roasted oat flakes and a balanced coffee bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness and a slightly velvety mouthfeel. Solid, well made and tasty stout. Very nice.

Pours dark brown to black with minimal tan head. Aroma of coffee, milk chocolate, chocolate malts, light smoke, light vanilla. Taste is chocolate and coffee bitter with light smoke in the finish. Body is a bit too light but creamy with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask conditioned at The Grapes, Oxford. Black with tan head. Big roast malt flavours, liquorice, chocolate but more on the sweetish, fruity side than bitter. There is a Port wine like flavour, some cherry and strawberry hints. There is a smoothness to it, lasting on the palate. Good stuff.
Nieźle pachnący (kawa, paloność) i wyglądający (bardzo ładna, brązowa piana), który okazał się za słodki dla mnie. Smak kawy z cukrem oraz popiołu słabo ze sobą współgrały. Bardzo słabo.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 First rating330 ml bottle at restaurant 2112 in Göteborg, on November 24, 2013.Label states 6.5% ABV, forgot to check the BB date.Black color, dark to very dark brown head. Sweet, malty, grainy, some smoke scent. Sweet, malty, grainy, coffee, roasted taste. Dry, grainy, roasted, coffee beans aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.No real wow factor in there for me, not bad, though dont stand out much either. 7/4/7/4/14=3.6Rerate33 cl bottle at "Södra Mat Bar Kaffe" in Gävle, May 29, 2015.Marked 6.5%, BB June 2015.Black color, dark brown head. Sweet, roasted scent, a bit metallic. Roasted, smoked, dry taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/4/6/3/12=3.2

1/3 taster glass, cask. Pitch black, crema head. Rills and looping cells in the head, very pretty. Very strong coffee aroma, b/g notes of smoke and wood. Bitter! Really is a coffee stout. Full, thick and oily. Breakfast stout though..? Is that a thing? Im starting my days wrong.

On tap at Nydalen Bryggeri, august 23rd 2013. Full black body, small tanned head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, grassy hops. Taste of coffee, toffee, plums. Good dry bitterness, aftertaste of licorice, roasted malt and a slight alcohol stinch. A very nice beer I enjoyed.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This inky black beer pours without any sort of head. It has rich milk chocolate and bitter coffee flavours, whisky notes and a warming, creamy and red fruity finish.

Bottle from Corks of Cotham, Bristol. Jet black and opaque, with a short-lived tan head. Big, charred malt aroma, with some oak, dark fruits, touch of vanilla and warming alcohol. Full mouth feel, with some dark chocolate, prunes and a dryish finish. Enjoyable.

from Erzbierschof - black beer under an elusive foam; roasted chocolatey aroma with light vanilla notes; some sweetness and a medium malt backbone; slightly dry and with a long dark chocolatey finish, more vanilla hints and a light nutty touch
Black with tan oiliness, thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee. Tastes like smooth creamy coffee choc beer! Nice long clean finish.

Fat på Rover. 
Fin med gräddig choklad, lakrits, kaffe, lätt rost, mjuk och lättdrucken.

Nice brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, dark malts, caramel, chocolate, licorice, biscuits, coffee, roasted grain, cocoa. Bottle
Aroma-chocolate, coffee, 
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-coffee, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, flat, long finish, 
Overall-unbelievably good

33cl, at 6.5%Vol, new exclusive English brew Anno 2013, from De Molen Beershop Bodegraven, complex sweet Stout, malty/roasted and slightly sweet/smoked, balanced, hazy, small head, good brew, yet expensive
On-tap. The Rover, Gothenburg. Almost black with a pale brown head. Roasted, malty, licorice, coffee, chocolate, milky, creamy, but still dry. Very tasty.

Bottled, 6.5%, BB Dec 2013, large sample. Dark color, short frothy brown head. Aroma of lots of roasted malts and coffee, chocolate, hint of smoke, hint of peat even. Quite dry in taste, bit sweet, medium bitter. The smoked malts dont provide much traditional smoked aromas, but ends up a bit more dry and peaty in flavor. Chocolate and coffee give a velvety feel. Very decent brew. Can imagine this to be even better from keg, when its usually more creamy.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small tan head. Aroma of coffee, pumpernickel, chocolate, licorice, biscuit, toast and light vanilla. On tap. Black colour with beige head. Chocolate and roasted aroma. Roasted and darkchocolate taste.

Tap @ Fermentoren.
Pours dark red-brown color with a small beige head. Aroma of malts, licorice, chocolate and caramel. Flavour of malts, chocolate, licorice and faint honey. Very creamy palate.
4314

Aroma: Leather, tobacco, cereal.
Appearance: Black, opaque, minimal tan head.
Taste: Sour, burned sugar, soy sauce.
Palate: light, oily low carbonation with a long roasty finish.
Overall: Thin and sour. Not the unctuous stout I was hoping for.

From tap at Ale&Hop, Barcelona. Pitch black coloured, small brown coloured, coffee/chicory nose. Roasted malt, coffee/chicory and dark chocolate with subdued notes of smoke. Mild carbonation with dry chocolate/coffee finish. Lets say this one could be balanced more but all in all ok stout.
Just a really nice stout, not too strong, well balanced with sweetness, a slight dryness and prominent cocoa aroma. Good.

How: Bottle.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm
Appearance: Black colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, chocolate, liquorice.
Body: Light body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, liquorice, coal.

Purchased this from Jacks Westholme Stores, Goring-on-Thames, Oxfordshire a couple of weeks ago. Consumed this sat in Frank (camper) at Camping Het Rieven, Amsterdam, Netherlands, Sunday 29th September 2013   Nice label! In the gloom of the camper lit up only by a multitude of Lozs candles this looks quite dark brown with a nice foamy light beige head. First things first this beer goes marvellously well with Elizabeth Shaw Chocolate Amaretto Flutes. The coffee in the beer combines well with the chocolate and amaretto flavours of Liz Shaws finest (£1 a box from Sainsburys, get em while you can). Nice lactic flavours with coffee and a quite lovely soft roastiness, plenty of bitter chocolate and coffee granules on the tongue. Really nice stout tastes classy but also accessible, its great. Much like the Maximus stout I had in Utrecht yesterday this would have put up a damn good showing at Borefts amongst some massive frankly slightly OTT but quite fun Imperial Stout offerings.  A8 A4 T8 P4 Ov17 4.1

Pours black , small and fast fading brown head 
Smells like coffee bitterness 
Taste is coffee , bitter . Not too much on the coffee .
Bottle. Dark dry mocca and chocolate. Really nice dark, savory aroa ma. Thinnish, but very flavourful body. Dark berries, roasted malts and dark dry chocolate. Everythings all nice here.

Tap. Deep brown/black with a light-brown head. Taste is a pleasant mix of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and a hint of liquorice and lovely vanilla. Sweet with a slightly bitter aftertaste of chocolate and the vanilla. Full body. Surprisingly good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sbwf13, bottled. Black colored, brown head. Robust, light smoky aroma, grounded coffee as well. Flavor has oat, coffee, roastedness with sweetness and hint of licorice in the finish. Nice one.-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

Bottled. Pours black with a tan head. Raw coffee notes, some beans and milk chocolate in aroma. Coffee and slightly bitter chocolate in taste. Nice roasted coffee in aftertaste. Feels a bit harsh though.

Tap at The Hanging Bat Edinburgh. Nice light coffee, choc, slight vanilla aroma. Medium body, mild carbonation. Full, rich. Nice balance of treacle, coffee, choc flavours with a good bitter finish. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Bishops Arms, Jönköping. Pitch black beer with a rich lasting beige/brownish head. Malty vanilla aroma, caramel, toffee, sweet licorice, roasted, dried fruits, cream, biscuits. Roasted malt and coffee flavor, caramel, soot, raisins, vanilla, cocoa, some chocolate. Roasted chocolate finish with caramel, raisins and vanilla. Drinkable, yet on the sweet side.
on cask at the hanging bat in edinburgh. dull black with a minimal brown head; aroma of nougat and coffee; some rumnraisin chocolate flavours and cookie dough, finishing bone dry. delicious

Bottle from Vino Wines. Black body with a thin tan head. Nice lacing. Aroma of ash, espresso and dark chocolate. Flavour is less intense than the aroma suggests - roasted malt, liquorice and tangy dark fruit. Thin body with a slick, oily texture. Soft carbonation. A decent, simple Stout, but its a bit on the thin side.

Bottle at Deans stickiest floor tasting. Pours a black opaque beer with a small, beige head on top. Aroma is of coffee, dark roasted malts and chocolate. There is also a very small amount of lactose or something similar. Flavor is full coffee with bitter chocolate. Long lasting, bittersweet aftertaste and sticky mouthfeel. Great brew!

Bottle. Near black with a thin beige foam. Aromas are chocolate and coffee with creamy oats and liquorice. Dark berries with raisins and medicinal notes. Flavours are sweet chocolate and oats with slightly tart berries and herbal notes. Creamy yet light bodied with some cola. Soap with a fruity finish. Pretty good.
Bottle @ press Deans button tasting. Aroma is nutty caramel with some chocolate. Flavour is the same. LRAB.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is roasted malt. The flavour is medium to weak bitter with a roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate creamy palate. Really smooth and totally awesome.

Bottle @ "This time Johan made the floor sticky" tasting. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized brown head. Smell malts, roasted malts, loads of chocolate and some coffee. Taste malts, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and bitter. Interesting and quite complex. Medium to fill body, medium carbonation. Very nicely done.
Bottle shared at THT. Pours near black with a small tan head. Aroma of roast, dark fruit, coffee. Flavour is light moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured deep dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of roast malt, dark chocolate. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, coffee.

Bottle shared @ JMDST
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Nice smooth stout.
Bottle. Smoke, tar, leather & coffee. Rich chocolatey & bitter, but with some nutty sweetness in the finish. A mighty stout

Tap at Bar Animal. Elegant espresso, roasted dark sugar nose
Black, brown lace
Sugared coffee, aromatic bitterness
Dry Creamy mouthfeel 
Coffe and chocolate retronasal 
Perfect desert stout
No head black/ tan pour. Smokey coffee cola aromas. Beautiful light and smooth palate. Big cola and light malts. Super smooth and just delicious. Britains best current brewer apart from Brodies!

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 Draught @ Cerveseria La Resistència, Barcelona. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee beans, dark chocolate and grass. Flavour of rich roasted malts, dark berries, pear, coffee and very prominent bitterness. Rich and full bodied with thick mouthfeel. Finishes soft, roasty and rich. The bourbon version was not as good as this.

Keg at the Hanging Bat. Jet black pour with thin tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, liquorice. Very rich and full bodied, roasted bitterness and chocolate sweetness. Good oily mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Long bitter finish. Excellent stout.
On tap. Black with mocca colored head. Aroma of coffee, black malt and some vinous noted. Taste fairly complex, coffee dominates. Decent beer
Pours dark brown. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and hay. Taste is medium sweet. Thick texture with soft carbonation. Average body.

Draft at Baccus, Newcastle on 27 July 2013.
Poured a black colour with a dense tan head, very appealing looking. Aroma however was saccharine mix of unbalanced blackjack and other sweets with a mix of stale tobacco and some acidic tones. Flavour contained a little roast malt, but then turned to over sweetened instant coffee with the residual taste of an ashtray (or what I imagine one would taste like). Three of us couldnt finish the one half pint between us... Probably eligible for a re-rate as this looks like it has pretty good ratings from others. Possibly a duff barrel, but it was keg...
Black with a nice dark tan head. Aroma of roast, coffee, bitter chocolate, ash. Taste of roast, chalk, coffee. Warming palate
Bottle. Notes of nougat, coffee, cream and oatmeal cereals. A bit dry. Somewhat portersque. Nicely drinkable.

Bottle at Bishops Folkis.
A bit odd smokey aroma. 
Nice porter like brew with taste of coffee and chocolate pudding.

Really, really black amber pour. I wanted chewy but this settled in very well. Bit porterish I thought. How do they decide which is which? Ive had a few broken dreams, most just through growing up. I mean, Im never going to be a space cowboy am I? Or a lumberjack, although that technically is attainable but the fact I dont like heights, know nothing about trees and cant use a saw, chain or manual, probably means this will never happen.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Dom wants chewy. I generally want chewy too. But this is a lovely Stout. Rich and hard. Flinty and briquettey. Nice beaver.
Frickin lovely! Sweet, thick and warm, with a little nose of alcohol that permeates your nostrils beautifully. Yes sir.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 Tap at Friends of Ham Leeds. I didnt really get the breakfast stout thing at first. Now Ive twigged it. Velvet dark chocolate. But 66%, not 80 odd.

Cask at #1 harbourside, bristol opaque black, subtle smokiness, milky latte on nose. Low carbonation, full bodied, coffee and smoke, roast barley, maple syrup, tobacco. Dry finish. Sugary Americano. Slightly sharp umami meatiness and a touch of mint. One to try again with a touch more gas I reckon.
330ml bottle at 6.5%.  Pours pitch black with a medium head. Aroma is bitter coffee with a touch of chocolate and smoke. Taste has cold coffee to start and a bitter chocolate and coffee finish.

Black stout with a thin beige head. Aroma is a coffee and chocolate blend. The initial taste is sweet chocolate and a touch of coffee, with a malty finish that I think has a bit of hop coming through as well. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Tap at CBC Clerkenwell. Black pour with a small beige head which quickly disappears. Nose is light cocoa, touch of pepper, and some bitter espresso tones. Some vanilla comes through in the taste but the mocha tones are the show here. Lengthy bitterness which works well with the light sweetness. Good beer. I had this after the Pappy aged version and now I see how the barrel ageing has turned this into a tremendous beer

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a longlasting off-white head. Has a roasted malty caramel and chocolate aroma. Roasted malty caramel and chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty caramel and chocolate finish.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Black with a small beige head. Nose is creamy, fattish burned malty with smooth coffee and chocolate accents and a little tørv. Flavor is sweet, dark malty, licorice and smokey accents. Light body, slightly watery texture and a long light to medium bitter, smooth finish. Not that far from a Limfjordsporter, but less edgy, less harsh, less intense.

Keg at PSBH, Manchester. Jet black with a light brown head. Aroma is all about bold coffee. On the tongue this is surprisingly soft and gentle, with lower carbonation than I expected and a roasted malt and liquorice taste. Finishes with coffee thats milder than that of the aroma. The mouthfeel probably lets it down most but this is pretty well done stuff.
Cask at the craft. Pitch black thin fleeting dark brown head. Big smooth coffee roast aroma. Long duration. Some dark fruit esters. Very soft carbonation. Very good.

Keg in The Lyric. Opaque very very dark brown, tiny off white head. Nose is roasted malt, charcoal, dark chocolate, black coffee. Its very chilled so not getting everything. Taste is just how I like my Breakfast stouts. Coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt dry bitterness. On the finish its black coffee.
Draught at CBC. Frothy white fair fully deminishing head. Black colour. Heavy malty and light hopy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Strong chocolate notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Black with a tiny beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, loads of chocolate and notes of coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 280413
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Black - offwhite head. Licorice. Nice malty. Ok burned malts. Smokey. Light sweetness. Light body and finish. Ok.

(on tap @ Mikkeller & Friends) Pours black with little, toffee head. Again, head resuscitation dermed futile due to glass shape and volume being served. Aroma is somewhat remniscient of the Limfjordsporter but more potent. Dark roasted malt with smoky and coffee notes and a hint of licorice. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body and a lingering, dry and roasted finish. Flavour has more emphasis on the coffee and licorice with a relatively subdued ascorbicity(?) from the roasted malt. Smooth, pleasant and eminently drinkable. Clearly meant for the UK pub market as a relatively sessionable drinker but with a lot of flavourful character nevertheless.
Tap @ Mikkeller,  Stefansgade.  Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, licorice and hops.

Chopp. Small brown creamish head. Pleasant sweet aroma of roasted malt and chocolate with bit smoke to it inderneath. Good filling mouthfeel. sweet well roasted maltiness in the flavour with chocolate and licorice , some coffee along with bit smoke. Quite nice.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 From tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and toffee. Bitter, roasted malte. Vague coffee hint, thick malty and dark malty. Thick and roasted dark finish.

From tap as Brown Dream, 6.7%, Søernes Ølbar. Pours pitch blach with small tan head. Roasted malty and chocolate. Bitter, light fruity and toasted malty. Solid caramelish and roasted. Lingering chocolate. Smooth malty, toffee, chocolate and mild bitter finish.8-4-8-4-16

Tap. Black with a small beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, herbal and light flowery hops. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, oily/creamy texture, soft carbonation. Light roasted dry and bitter finish.

Draught at Mikkeller and Friends.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of dark chocolate and licorice with burnt notes.
Sweet and roasted flavour of dark chocolate, caramel and roasted bread.
Roasted finish.

Draft. A pitch black beer with a thin brown head. The aroma has strong notes of coffee, combined with medium notes of roasted malt and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of coffee, roasted malt, and bitter dark chocolate, leading to a dry roasted finish.

Appearance: Black as the deepest dungeon. A nice big beige head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Coffee and roasted dark malt.Palate: Medium + body. Moderate sweet with a fine bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Lots of coffee, roasted malt and chocolate.Overall impression: Soild stuff. Maybe the best stout I have had that is not listed as Imperial Stout.Personal stats: On tap at BrewDog Birmingham in Birmingham, England.English county #39

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2015 Cask @ Devonshire Cat, Sheffield [100615]
Pitch black, dense tan creamy head. Nose of smooth roast, some dark chocolate, soft fruity coffee, hint of vanilla. Taste of deep dark rich malts, dark fruits, smooth fruity coffee, mellow roast. Medium to full body, soft sweet, very smooth, silky, rich, no alcohol. Finish of smooth mellow malts. Think this was 6.7%. Really tasty - this is better on cask than keg. Fantastic stout - this is going straight up to 4.1.

Keg @ Hanging Bat, Edinburgh [020413] 7/2/8/4/16 3.7
Jet black, no head, no lacing
Aroma of roasted malts, deep roast, chocolate, dark sweet malts, initial roast aroma disappeared after a while
Taste of roasted malts, dark deep malts, lots of dark quite sweet chocolate, really good flavour
Palate - Very soft carb, medium body, keg carb rather flat but no problem for me, nice smooth dark malts. Finish - rich chocolately malts, really nice long rich linger, you can almost chew the malts in your mouth during the finish, yummy
Overall - Great beer..bit flat from the keg....rather expensive for a 6% beer

On keg at Craft Beer Co., Clerkenwell, 20/03/13. 6.5%. Quite dry and roasty, but not a lot of body to back it up. Could do with more sweet malt. Nice, beany coffee taste though and a good, dry roasty aftertaste.
Keg at Brewdog Birmingham; black pour with off white head,  roasted coffee bean aroma, coffee comes through in the taste some plain chocolate.

Cask handpump at The Ale House, Chelmsford. A glorious stout, very dark with a nice mid-brwon head. Full bodied and rich. Strong aroma of cocoa. Went back next day for more but had run out...broken dream indeed.
Cask at the 14th Egham Beer Festival - ABV 6.5%. An opaque black pour with a scummy tan head; aroma of chocoalte malt; thick grainy body with a milky chocolate flavour; and a sweet grainy finish.
Dunkler Antrunk mit leichten Kaffeenoten. Spritzig, wenig trocken, süffig. Konstant malzig, leichte Espressonoten. Rund, wenig hopfig. 11/12/10/10//11
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Very dark, of course, and very small head. Licorice overtones.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 keg at the bat ... dark black ... no head ... soft deep mellow chocolate roast nose.... ahh little too fizzy ... dark roast ... light charcoal ... soft licorice .. lightes coffee ... some milk sugers ... nice 3.8
Cask at the bow... Deep black... Thin tan head... Deep rich coffee chocolate nose... Dark malts rich roast...coffee... Light lactose... Tiny licorice 4.2

Cask at Craft, Islington, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a thin beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, chocolate, a little coffee. Tasty but a little on the thin side for a stout.

Cask at Craft Clerkenwell. It pours opaque dark brown with a small tan head. The nose is roasty, rich coffee, cocoa powder, faint smoke and earth. The taste is roasted malt, smooth coffee, mild acidity, earth, light bitterness, light smokiness, touch of sweetness and only a hint of dark fruit with a dry finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Smooth, tasty and well-balanced. Perhaps a touch thin and lacking a bit in carbonation, but a very nice breakfast stout nonetheless.

9th March 2013Craft Islington. Cask. Opaque black brown beer, bubbly tan head. Smooth palate with very mild carbonation. Semi dry. Light and tangy dark malt. Well buried trace of dark fruit. Mellow coffee in good balance. Semi dry finish. Fresh and tasty.

Cask at Craft Beer Co Clerkenwell, 09/03/13.
Mid black with a thin tan head that dissipates edgeward and leaves a small film.
Nose is chocolate, roast malt, sugars, coffee.
Taste comprises roast malt, good dose of coffee, chocolate, sugars.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, dryish finish.
Great stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask and keg at CBC Islington, London. Ill my favourite, the key version. It pours a deep dark brown colour with a nice frothy head. Aroma is intensely roasty and hoppy, with all the good notes of coffee, wood, dark chocolate and hops. Taste is similarly bold and upfront with a nice balance between the malty sweetness and the roasty hoppy bitterness. Silky body with good carbonation. Great breakfast stout, loved it.
Cask at craft, 13th march 13. Good clean and smooth stout, I liked this, probably more so than the chili version
Cask handpull. Black beer. Again minimal carbonation. Good choc and coffee. Decent stout. A little thin but needs better carbonation
